meanings.definition: Make into or carry out as a ritual.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, she ritualised her skincare routine by following the same steps in the same order.
meanings.sent2: The tribe ritualised their traditional dance to honor their ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The cat ritualised its daily routine of napping in different spots around the house.
meanings.sent4: The students ritualised the process of preparing for their exams, treating it like a sacred ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The chef ritualised the art of plating dishes, ensuring each element was placed with precision.

meanings.definition: Engage in or perform as a ritual.
meanings.sent1: The family ritualised their Sunday brunch by always going to the same restaurant.
meanings.sent2: During the full moon, the villagers ritualised a dance around the bonfire.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ritualised its morning routine of gathering nuts, almost like a little dance.
meanings.sent4: The team ritualised their pre-game pep talk, turning it into a motivational ritual.
meanings.sent5: The artist ritualised the process of setting up their easel, creating a calming routine before painting.
